title: Conquer Your Studies: Strategic Battle Plan study dashboard with Divide & Conquer tasks

requirements.text: Create the app shell and primary navigation for "Conquer Your Studies: Your Epic Learning Journey" with two main areas: (1) a War Map-style syllabus dashboard and (2) a "Divide and Conquer" task breakdown section.

quotes: I want to create a web app called "Conquer Your Studies: Your Epic Learning Journey".

Key Features:
1. A dashboard that looks like a War Map of the syllabus.
2. A "Divide and Conquer" section to break chapters into small tasks.

acceptanceCriteria: App header displays the full app name exactly as provided.
There are two clearly accessible primary sections/pages: Dashboard (War Map) and Divide and Conquer.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a consistent "Strategic Battle Plan" visual theme that is bold and adventurous, including typography, spacing, and UI styling, and enforce the provided section color system across the interface: Red=Mission Critical (difficult/high-priority), Blue=Tactical Drills (revision/practice tests), Green=Victory Zone (completed), Yellow=Scouting (new topics).

quotes:
The design should look like a "Strategic Battle Plan" for students. Please use these colors for different sections:
- Red: For difficult/high-priority subjects (Mission Critical).
- Blue: For revision and practice tests (Tactical Drills).
- Green: For completed topics (Victory Zone).
- Yellow: For new topics (Scouting).

Make the interface look bold and adventurous!

acceptanceCriteria: Each of the four statuses is visually distinguishable and consistently mapped to the specified color and label (Mission Critical / Tactical Drills / Victory Zone / Scouting).
Theme is applied consistently across pages (buttons, cards, badges, headers) and reads as bold/adventurous (not minimal/neutral).

requirements.text: Build the "War Map of the syllabus" dashboard UI that presents syllabus items as map-like nodes/territories, showing each item’s current status (Scouting, Mission Critical, Tactical Drills, Victory Zone) using the defined color-coded styling and labels.

quotes: A dashboard that looks like a War Map of the syllabus.

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard renders a collection of syllabus items in a map-like layout (nodes/tiles connected or arranged as territories).
Each syllabus item shows its title and current status label and color.
User can visually scan the map and identify which items are Scouting/Mission Critical/Tactical Drills/Victory Zone by color and label.

requirements.text: Implement the "Divide and Conquer" section UI to select a syllabus chapter/topic and break it into smaller tasks, with the ability to create, view, update, and mark tasks as completed (moving them into the Victory Zone status).

quotes: A "Divide and Conquer" section to break chapters into small tasks.

acceptanceCriteria: User can create a chapter/topic and add multiple smaller tasks under it.
User can mark tasks complete and see completion reflected in the UI (including Victory Zone color/label where applicable).
Edits (create/update/complete) persist after page refresh (not purely in-memory).

requirements.text: Add backend persistence for syllabus items and tasks with status values that support the four strategic zones (Scouting, Mission Critical, Tactical Drills, Victory Zone), and expose query/update methods consumed by the frontend via React Query.

quotes:
Please use these colors for different sections:
- Red: For difficult/high-priority subjects (Mission Critical).
- Blue: For revision and practice tests (Tactical Drills).
- Green: For completed topics (Victory Zone).
- Yellow: For new topics (Scouting).

acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides methods to: list syllabus items, create/update syllabus item status, list tasks by chapter/topic, create/update/complete tasks.
Statuses are restricted to the four supported values and returned consistently to the frontend.
Frontend reads/writes through backend calls (with React Query caching/invalidation) and data persists across refresh.

requirements.text: Display the provided motivational quote at the end of the primary user flow/interface (e.g., at the bottom of the Dashboard and/or as a dedicated closing section), using prominent styling consistent with the bold/adventurous theme.

quotes: Use this quote at the end: "Embrace the challenges, celebrate your discoveries, and unlock your full learning potential. Your quest for knowledge awaits – go forth and conquer!"

acceptanceCriteria: The quote text appears exactly as provided (including punctuation and dash).
Quote is placed at the end of the interface/flow (visually bottom-most closing section on at least one main page).

requirements.text: Add required generated static art assets to support the War Map/Battle Plan look, and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images from the backend).

quotes: The design should look like a "Strategic Battle Plan" for students.
Make the interface look bold and adventurous!

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
At least one generated background/hero image is visibly used in the app shell or dashboard without breaking readability.
No backend endpoints are used to fetch these static images.

constraints: Use only Internet Computer canister backend (Motoko) and a single-actor architecture for backend logic.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths defined by the system; only compose/consume those components.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not add third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity would be allowed, but it is not required for this request).
Do not implement real-time collaboration/chat, notifications, emails, or external database integrations.

required: Parchment-style war map background texture with subtle grid and compass rose (war-map-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Bold adventurous emblem/badge icon set: sword, shield, flag, compass (battle-icons.dim_512x512.png)
Wide header banner with "Strategic Battle Plan" aesthetic (battle-banner.dim_1600x400.png)
